title: Osaka Advances in Australian Open Amid Post-Match Tension with Cirstea
summary: Naomi Osaka secured a victory over Sorana Cirstea in the Australian Open second round, winning 6-3, 4-6, 6-2 on Margaret Court Arena. The match concluded with a tense post-match exchange, as Cirstea offered a brief cold handshake and confronted Osaka at the umpire's chair. Osaka explained in an on-court interview that Cirstea was angry about her frequent 'come ons' used to motivate herself between serves, leading Osaka to apologize. Cirstea, aged 35, is nearing retirement after announcing she will end her 20-year WTA Tour career in 2026, making this her final Australian Open appearance. Osaka also discussed her unique jellyfish-inspired outfit, a toned-down version from a previous match, which she uses as a form of self-expression on court. She expressed hope to advance further in the tournament, aiming for the fourth round for the first time since her 2021 championship win.
